articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli shelling hit southern Lebanese towns on Wednesday in response to anti-tank rockets fired from Lebanon, as cross-border violence extended into a fourth day.
articles.title: Israeli shelling hits south Lebanon after rocket fire

articles.author: Jonathan Saul, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel's military has rallied after an initial chaotic scramble to halt an assault by Palestinian Islamist group Hamas and is retaliating with airstrikes on roads, buildings and other sites in Gaza while sending huge reinforcements towards the enclave.
articles.title: After Hamas attack, Israeli retaliation tactics raise Gaza invasion fears

articles.author: Ahmed Mohamed Hassan, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Egypt is moving to avert a mass exodus from the Gaza Strip into its Sinai Peninsula, as Israeli bombardment halted crossings at the main exit point from the Palestinian enclave on Tuesday, Gaza officials and Egyptian security sources said.
articles.title: Egypt moves to prevent exodus of Palestinians from besieged Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The fighting between Israel and Hamas, which launched a surprise attack on Saturday, is the latest in seven decades of war and conflict between Israelis and Palestinians that has drawn in outside powers and destabilised the wider Middle East.
articles.title: What's the Israel-Palestinian conflict about? The origin of wars explained

articles.author: Napat Wesshasartar, Thomas Suen
articles.description: The last time Thai mother Noopar Pansa-ard said she heard from her son, gunfire and explosions crackled in the background as he told her to stay strong if anything happened to him.
articles.title: Grieving Thai family pleads for return of son's body from Israel

articles.author: Philip Pullella, Alvise Armellini
articles.description: Pope Francis, in his strongest comments since the start of the conflict in Gaza, on Wednesday called for the release of all hostages taken by Hamas militants and said Israel has a right to defend itself.
articles.title: Pope urges Hamas to free hostages, says Israel has right to self-defence

articles.author: Sheila Dang, Riniki Sanyal
articles.description: The rapid spread of misleading claims and doctored images in the aftermath of a deadly rampage by Hamas gunmen in Israel has put the focus on Elon Musk's X platform, which has drawn the ire of the European Union.
articles.title: False claims on Israel-Hamas war mushroom online, put focus on Musk's X

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Laila Bassam
articles.description: Israel calls last week's devastating attack by Hamas its 9/11 moment. The secretive mastermind behind the assault, Palestinian militant Mohammed Deif, calls it Al Aqsa Flood.
articles.title: How a secretive Hamas commander masterminded the attack on Israel

articles.author: Maayan Lubell, Emily Rose
articles.description: A baby's crushed crib lying outside a burnt-out home. Corpses strewn on streets. Body bags lined up on an outdoor basketball court. The stench of death everywhere.
articles.title: How an Israeli kibbutz 'paradise' turned into hell in Hamas attack

articles.author: David Morgan, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Republicans in the U.S. House of Representatives will try to unite around a new speaker to lead their fractious and narrow majority on Wednesday, a week after a small group of dissidents ousted Kevin McCarthy.
articles.title: US House Republicans seek to unite around a new speaker
